Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment/Detention as to Felix Javier De Jesus-Negron (9) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 4/27/2015. Present were AUSA Teresa Zapata and Mr. Rafael Castro-Lang. Dft was present and under custody. Defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Cerezo for scheduling. As to bail, the Government requested detention and proffer part of the evidence. Mr. Castro-Lang argued in agreement with the Pretrial report and proffer conditions of release. Sidebar held. After hearing the arguments from the parties, bail was set in the amount of $5,000.00 unsecured with defendant's and his wife's signature, home incarceration with EM, UA and/or treatment, plus all other standard conditions of release. (Court Reporter  -DCR.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:21.Hearing ended at 09:32. Interpreter - Sonia Crescioni. (yr) (Entered: 04/28/2015)

ORDER Setting Conditions of Release as to Felix Javier De Jesus-Negron (9) $5,000.00 unsecured with defendant's and his wife's signature. Signed by US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive on 4/27/2015. (nat) (Entered: 04/28/2015)
*RESTRICTED* Appearance Bond Entered as to Felix Javier De Jesus-Negron (9) in amount of $5,000.00 unsecured. (nat) (Entered: 04/28/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment/Detention as to Ricardo Romero-Baerga (29) Count 1,2,3,4 held on 4/27/2015. Present were AUSA Teresa Zapata and Mr. Raymond Sanchez-Maceira. Dft was present and under custody. Defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Cerezo for scheduling. As to bail, the Government opposed the recommendation made by Pretrial as to bail. Mr. Sanchez stated that at this time they were not seeking bail, but reserved the right to reopen hearing. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail. Order to issue. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment/Detention as to Alexis Vega-Maldonado (28) Count 1,2,3,4 held on 4/27/2015. Present were AUSA Teresa Zapata and Ms Mariela Maestre. Dft was present and under custody. Defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment/Detention as to Jose M. Del Valle-Sanchez (21) Count 1,2,3,4 held on 4/27/2015. Present were AUSA Teresa Zapata and Mr. Alex Rosa-Ambert. Dft was present and under custody. Defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Cerezo for scheduling. As to bail, the Government had no objection to bail but requested more strict conditions. Bail was set in the amount of $5,000.00 unsecured with defendant's signature, work and/or study, UA and/or treatment, curfew, reside outside the housing projects mentioned in the indictment and not to approach or enter any of them, plus standard conditions of release. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Change of Plea Hearing as to Angel Morales-De Jesus (1) held on 9/15/2016.  Present were AUSA Alberto Lopez and Ms Anita Hill. Defendant was present and under custody. Waiver of JT and consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant is found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. Defendant is advised of the maximum penalties he's facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving said rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Judge Cerezo so that the guilty plea as to counts One (1) and Five (5) of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Defendant will remain under custody. Sentencing Hearing set for 12/12/2016 at 04:40 PM in Courtroom 4 before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Change of Plea Hearing as to Jean Gonzalez-Lopez (25) held on 1/10/2017. Present were AUSA Teresa Zapata and defense counsel Israel Alicea. Defendant was under custody, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. Consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant was found competent to plea. The defendant was advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will  issue a Report and Recommendation to Carmen C. Cerezo, U.S. District Judge so that the guilty plea as to count one (1) of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Sentencing Hearing is set for 4/10/2017 at 4:15 PM in Courtroom 4 before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 9:30 am. Hearing held at 10:59 am. Hearing ended at 11:19 am. Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (cmd) (Entered: 01/11/2017)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Change of Plea Hearing as to Jaime Rosario-Valdes (3) held on 5/4/2017. Present were AUSA Teresa Zapata and AFPD Giovanni Canino. The defendant was under custody, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. Consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant was found competent to plea. The defendant was advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Carmen C. Cerezo, U.S. District Judge so that the guilty plea as to count one (1) and five (5) of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Sentencing Hearing is set for 8/1/2017 at 4:30 PM in Courtroom 4 before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 2:00 pm. Hearing held at 3:53 pm. Hearing ended at 4:12 pm. Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (cmd) (Entered: 05/05/2017)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo: Sentencing held on 3/14/2018 for Luis Acevedo-Torres (4). Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata, Atty. Raul Mariani and USPO Natalia Matos. Government's statement was heard. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Change of Plea Hearing as to Jorge L. Garcia-Cruz (7) held on 7/13/2018. Present were AUSA Teresa S. Zapata-Valladares, and court appointed counsel Ramon L. Garay- Medina. The defendant was present in court, under the custody of the U.S. Marshals, and was assisted certified court interpreter. This defendant, and co-defendant Eric Diaz- Torres (7) agreed that the change of plea hearing be seen at the same time. It was stated for the record that this defendant plead guilty on March 16, 2018 before U.S.M.J. Bruce J. McGiverin, docket no. 987. Report and Recommendation issued on March 28, 2018 at docket no. 990. Motion to withdraw plea of guilty filed on April 4, 2018 at docket no. 996. Order issued by the Court on April 30, 2018 at docket no. 1005 granting defendant's motion to withdraw plea of guilty filed at docket no. 996. Finally, motion for change of plea filed at docket no. 1031, and then referred for change of plea hearing and randomly assigned to USJM Velez-Rive at docket no. 1033. Consent to proceed before USM and waiver of JT was approved. The defendant was found competent to plea. The defendant was advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. The defendant plead guilty to count One (1), and Five (5) of the Indictment. The U.S. Magistrate Judge will recommend to the Court that the Plea of Guilty be accepted as to Count One (1), and Five (5) of the Indictment. The defendant is to remain under custody. A report and recommendation will be issued. A written Pre-sentence Report was ordered to be prepared by the United States Probation Office. Sentencing Hearing set for 10/12/2018 01:30 PM in Courtroom 4 before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo. (Court Reporter DCR.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:47. Hearing ended at 10:23 Interpreter Felix Toledo. (om) (Entered: 07/13/2018)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo: Sentencing held on 10/1/2018 for Hermes Torres- Vazquez (8). Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata, Atty. Jorge Rivera and USPO Ariana Guzman. Government's statement was heard. Count(s) 1, 5, IMPR: Eighteen (18) months as to Count One and thirty (30) months as to Count Five to be served consecutively to each other for a total of forty-eight (48) months. SRT: Eight (8) years as to Count One and five (5) years as to Count Five, to be served concurrently with each other. No fine. SMA of $100.00 per count. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo: Sentencing held on 12/10/2018 for Kenneth O, Ayala-Guevara (16). Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata, Atty. Diana Lopez and USPO Brenda Davila (for USPO Carolina Aparicio). Defendant was OB, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Defense counsel brought some concerns regarding defendant's acceptance of responsibility as it appears in the PSR. The Court informed counsel that the matter should be directly addressed with the USPO who conducted the interview. After some discussion, defense counsel withdrew her request to amend the PSR. However, when inquired by the Court, defendant stated he believed the sentencing hearing should be postponed if there were inaccuracies in the report. After having held a sidebar with both parties and the USPO present in court, the Court decided to continue the sentencing hearing. Sentencing Hearing to be continued on 12/17/2018 at 2:00 PM in Courtroom 4 before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo. The Court informed the defendant as to why the sentencing hearing was being continued. Defense counsel stated that she would meet with the defendant in order to clear any doubts that he may have. (Court Reporter Zulma Ruiz.) Hearing set for 1:30 PM. Hearing held at 1:38 PM. Hearing ended at 2:03 PM. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (bgl) Modified location information on 12/11/2018 (idg). (Entered: 12/11/2018)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan:Preliminary Revocation Hearing re 1242 Motion Notifying Violations of Supervision Conditions as to Hermes Torres- Vazquez (8) held on 11/14/2019. Present: AUSA Enrique Silva, AFPD Edwin Mora and USPO Alexandria Oliveras. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. The defendant filed a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing Form. The Court approved the waiver and found probable cause pursuant to Rules 5 and 32.1 of the Fed.R.Crim.P. The case was referred to U.S. District Judge Carmen C. Cerezo for Final Revocation Hearing. AFPD Mora moved for conditions of release pending final hearing and informed that the alleged victim, Arlene Fontanez, was present and available to be questioned by the Court. AUSA Silva objected to the defense's request and proffered that the Government had a video of one of the domestic violence incidents. There was a recess to allow the Court to review the video in Chambers. Case was recalled at 11:47 AM. The Government read aloud a statement written in the Spanish language by Ms. Fontanez, in which she described two domestic violence incidents. The statement was translated for the record by a certified court interpreter. The Court called Ms. Fontanez to the stand and questioned her under oath. USPO Oliveras recommended detention. After reviewing the evidence and hearing the parties and the witness, the Court denied the defense's motion for conditions of release. The defendant shall remain detained pending final revocation hearing. Evidence admitted: Government's Exhibits 1 and 2. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release set for 1/13/2020 02:00 PM in Courtroom 4 before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo. (Court Reporter DCR-Courtroom 6.)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 09:59.Hearing ended at 12:25.Interpreter Thomas Kavelin. (lod) (Entered: 11/22/2019)

Defendant is contesting the alleged violations. AFPD Mora stated that defendant will request the dismissal of both motions. The Court of Appeals issued last Friday two opinions discussing PR state cases in regards to the definition of crime of violence and controlled substances charges. If a continuance is granted, it is defendant's position that these are Grade B violations. Government requested a brief continuance to review the legal aspects in light of the recent decisions by the Court of Appeals. No objection from defendant. The Court granted the request based on defendant's pending hearing in state court and the recent opinions by the COA. COPY OF ORDER (filed in Civil No. 20-1201 GAG) as to Jesus M. Gonzalez (5). Denying 1 Motion to Vacate. The hablas petition under Section 2255 is denied. Petitioner generically claims ineffective assistance of counsel for a myriad of reasons, as well a violation of due process. Assuming, arguendo, that his allegations are correct, defendant has not been prejudiced. This is so, given that he received the exact sentence he bargained for in his plea agreement. ORDER re 1293 Motion to Reduce Sentence as to Misael Diaz-Torres (10). Defendant is serving an 84 months sentence and has petitioned, pro se, for compassionate release. In doing so, he alludes to stringent conditions of confinement resulting from restrictions imposed by the Bureau of Prisons protocols to avoid health risks correlated to COVID- 19. Defendant does not assert having complied with exhaustion of administrative remedies by having presented his petition, in first instance, to the Warden. Nor has defendant alluded to any specific or health issues placing him under real and immediate harm. Accordingly, his petition is DENIED. Signed by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 6/17/2020. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan: Preliminary Revocation Hearing re 1282 Motion Notifying SRT Violations as to Hector E. Navarro-Santisteban (26) held on 6/29/2020. Present: AUSA Evelyn Canals, AFPD Victor Chico and USPO George Maymi. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. The Court found that the defendant, after conferring with counsel, knowingly and voluntarily waived his right to attend this hearing in person and consented to having his Preliminary Revocation Hearing held by way of VTC. The defendant filed a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing at Docket No. 1307 . The Court approved the waiver and entered a finding of probable cause as to all violations included in the motion at Docket No. 1282 , pursuant to Rules 5 and 32.1 of the Fed.R.Crim.P. The case was referred to U.S. District Judge Francisco A. Besosa for Final Revocation Hearing. AFPD Chico requested that the defendant be released to a residential treatment program pending the final hearing. AUSA Canals had no objection and agreed that the defendant would benefit from treatment. USPO Maymi's statements regarding community safety concerns were heard. After having heard the parties, the Court denied the defense's request and ordered the defendant detained pending further proceedings. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release set for 9/2/2020 09:00 AM in Courtroom 2 before Judge Francisco A. Besosa. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Show Cause Hearing as to Eric Diaz-Torres held on 7/23/2020 via VTC. Present were AUSA Enrique Silva, AFPD Samantha Drake, USPO Angelica Rodriguez. Defendant was OB and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Defendant was present via telephone. All other parties were present via VTC. Counsel for the defendant attested that the defendant was the person appearing by telephone. The defendant waived his right to appear physically at the hearing and consented to proceed via telephone conference. Government argued in favor of the USPO's request for conditions to be modified to include electronic monitoring for a period of three months. Defendant requested for the Court to consider other alternatives, such as a curfew and daily check- ins with USPO. Having heard the parties, the Court recommends that the USPO's request, as joined by the Government, be granted by the presiding district judge. The Court finds that there appears to be no general dispute that the defendant committed the acts as alleged in the motion, that 18 U.S.C. § 3583(e)(4) provides the Court with the authority to impose home detention with electronic monitoring and that this changed condition is reasonably relevant to the alleged violation of his conditions of release, as well as necessary for the USPO to continue supervising the defendant. The parties are provided fourteen (14) days to file any objections to the Court's oral Report and Recommendation. (Court Reporter Joe Reynosa.) Hearing set for 01:30. Hearing held at 01:41. Hearing ended at 02:38. Interpreter Felix Toledo. (bgl) (Entered: 08/03/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan: Initial Appearance re: Revocation of Supervised Release as to Hector E. Navarro- Santisteban (26) was held on 6/29/2021. Present: AUSA Yanira Colon and AFPD Isabel Mattina. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. The Court found that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived his right to attend this hearing in person and consented to proceed by way of VTC. The defendant was advised of the SRT violations alleged in the Motion filed by USPO Moringlane at Docket No. 1385 . The defendant was also advised of his rights, including his right to a preliminary hearing. The Federal Public Defender was appointed to represent the defendant. The Court ordered the defendant temporarily detained pending further proceedings. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, Pub. L. No. 116-182, 134 Stat. 894 (Oct. 21, 2020) and Rule 5(f) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure, the United States is reminded of its obligation to disclose in a timely manner all exculpatory evidence to the defendant(s], that is, all evidence that is favorable to the defendant(s] or tends to cast doubt on the United States' case, as required by Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny. Failure to comply with this order may result in consequences, including, but  not limited to, the reversal of any conviction, the exclusion of evidence, adverse jury instructions, dismissal of charges, contempt proceedings, disciplinary action, and/or sanctions by the Court. A Preliminary Revocation Hearing was set for 7/6/2021 at 2:30 PM via VTC Bridge MDM before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan. (Court Reporter DCR/ ZoomGov Recording.)Hearing held at 01:19. Hearing ended at 01:24. Interpreter Lisa Leilanie Solis. (mig) Modified on 7/2/2021 to correct USPO's last name (ab). (Entered: 07/01/2021)
